Key Match Events: Jos Buttler and Alex Hales produced a devastating display of hitting to power England into the final with four overs to spare
Hardik Pandya scored 63 from 33 balls with five sixes, including 59 from his last 24 deliveries
Rishabh Pant was run out by Chris Jordan
Virat Kohli was caught by Rashid off Jordan for 50
Pre-Game Insights: England won the toss and chose to bowl
Predictions or expectations about the match outcome were not explicitly mentioned
Strategies and preparations discussed by teams or players were not explicitly mentioned
Anticipated key player matchups or rivalries were not explicitly mentioned
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler expressed excitement about being in the final
Rohit Sharma acknowledged that India's bowling was not up to par
Adil Rashid praised the openers' performance and expressed hope for the final
Alex Hales was named player of the match and expressed happiness about the occasion
Miscellaneous Highlights: The partnership of 170 is the highest for any wicket in a men’s T20 World Cup
This is the first time in England’s T20 history that they’ve had three consecutive opening stands of 50 or more
Chris Jordan finished with R-rated figures of 4-0-42-0
